CVE-2024-29847
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-09-13T00:31:50

9 posts

Deserialization of untrusted data in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-29847

obivan at 2024-09-20T13:42:31.657Z ##

Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) Pre-Auth RCE CVE-2024-29847 https://summoning.team/blog/ivanti-epm-cve-2024-29847-deserialization-rce/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-17T12:23:42.692Z ##

Update: Exploit code for CVE-2024-29847 is available now!!

Link: https://summoning.team/blog/ivanti-epm-cve-2024-29847-deserialization-rce/

IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

#CyberSecurity #Ivanti #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T19:38:17.557Z ##

Following Summoning Team's accusation that Horizon3 published a vulnerability details and proof of concept for the wrong CVE, Horizon3 updated their blog post: CVE-2023-28324 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Improper Input Validation

We initially wrote this post in reference to CVE-2024-29847, however this post actually describes CVE-2023-28324. We had incorrectly assumed that the SU5 update was comprehensive which resulted in us mistaking CVE-2023-28324 for CVE-2024-29847. The content of this blog has been updated accordingly.

h/t: @buherator cc: @cR0w

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T19:20:32.000Z ##

Exploit code released for critical Ivanti RCE flaw, patch now

A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-29847, a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager, is now...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/564e6i

##
obivan@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T13:42:31.000Z ##

Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) Pre-Auth RCE CVE-2024-29847 https://summoning.team/blog/ivanti-epm-cve-2024-29847-deserialization-rce/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-16T19:38:17.000Z ##

Following Summoning Team's accusation that Horizon3 published a vulnerability details and proof of concept for the wrong CVE, Horizon3 updated their blog post: CVE-2023-28324 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Improper Input Validation

We initially wrote this post in reference to CVE-2024-29847, however this post actually describes CVE-2023-28324. We had incorrectly assumed that the SU5 update was comprehensive which resulted in us mistaking CVE-2023-28324 for CVE-2024-29847. The content of this blog has been updated accordingly.

h/t: @buherator cc: @cR0w

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T19:20:32.000Z ##

Exploit code released for critical Ivanti RCE flaw, patch now

A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-29847, a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager, is now...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/564e6i

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T15:04:13.000Z ##

@cR0w yeah I want to see all the relevant information at a glance:

  • CVE ID
  • CVSS score
  • disclosure date
  • if it's got a proof of concept
  • If it's exploited (on the KEV)
  • and the vendor/product
  • and the impact of the vulnerability
  • most importantly, with LINKS to back it up!!

which is why I try to include it all myself when I share vulnerabilities with others:

CVE-2024-29847 (10.0 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, has proof of concept) Ivanti EPM deserialization to RCE vulnerability.

The only issue is my own constant flip flopping of CVSS version numbers as vendors start adopting CVSSv4. Currently it's unusual, so everything I post is implied to be CVSSv3.1, and I explicitly write CVSSv4 when it's the only score available. But moving forward, I should include the version number for every CVSS score.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T14:55:45.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-29847 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: CVE-2024-29847 (10.0 critical 🥳) Deserialization of untrusted data in Ivanti EPM = RCE (see parent toot above for security advisory)

Damn Horizon3, back at it again with the proof of concept and technical details for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) vulnerability CVE-20244-29847. While they state that this is a straightforward remote code execution, they have two caveats: while it technically involves deserialization, Horizon3 wants to describe it as command injection. There's also the vulnerability's interaction with the firewall.
Horizon3 at least demonstrates how to see if you're being exploited by CVE-2024-29847: "Any unexpected connections to the AgentPortal address in your environment should be investigated for malicious activity." cc: @cR0w

#CVE_2024_29847 #Ivanti #IvantiEPM #vulnerability #proofofconcept #vulnerabilityanalysis #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-28990
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-12T15:33:10

3 posts

SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow access to the RabbitMQ management console. We thank Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) for its ongoing partnership in coordinating with SolarWinds on responsible disclosure of this and other potential vulnerabilities.

1 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T11:50:52.963Z ##

@chudypb mentioned this earlier in the parent toot above but I'll include the security advisory now that it's live:
SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28990)
CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium, CVE was assigned 12 September 2024)
SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow access to the RabbitMQ management console.

CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium, CVE was assigned 12 September 2024)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T14:05:06.000Z ##

SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28991)
CVE-2024-28991 (9.0 critical, disclosed 12 September 2024) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.
Reported by Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

EDIT: Piotr states that CVE-2024-28991 can be chained with CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability for pre-authenticated remote code execution.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28991 #cve

CVE-2024-8639
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-09-12T15:33:00

1 posts

Use after free in Autofill in Google Chrome on Android prior to 128.0.6613.137 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.000Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##

1 posts

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.000Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia

A vulnerability in the JSON-RPC API feature in ConfD that is used by the web-based management interfaces of Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator (NSO), Cisco Optical Site Manager, and Cisco RV340 Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to modify the configuration of an affected application or device. This vulnerability is due to improper authorization c

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

##

CVE-2024-8190
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 15.12%

updated 2024-09-10T21:31:40

18 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability in Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance versions 4.6 Patch 518 and before allows a remote authenticated attacker to obtain remote code execution. The attacker must have admin level privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-8190

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.644Z ##

CISA: Ivanti Releases Admin Bypass Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance
Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T16:26:12.067Z ##

Ivanti exploited zero-day: Security Advisory Ivanti CSA 4.6 (Cloud Services Appliance) (CVE-2024-8963)
CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-17T10:30:03.000Z ##

tecteschi@mastodon.social at 2024-09-17T05:01:59.000Z ##

https://go.twuai.com/ping/7415472855212487378 Ivanti ha revelado una vulnerabilidad crítica en su Cloud Service Appliance (CSA), rastreada como CVE-2024-8190, que permite a los atacantes ejecutar comandos remotos. Esta falla afecta a la versión 4.6 del software y ha sido añadida a la lista de vulnerabilidades explotadas por CISA. Los clientes deben aplicar el parche lanzado el 10 de septiembre de 2024 para mitigar el...

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T15:34:57.864Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-8190: Investigating CISA KEV Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance Command Injection Vulnerability
See parent toots above for information and links to Ivanti's Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability CVE-2024-8190, I'm too lazy to link them repeatedly.

@hacks_zach of Horizon3 takes a closer look at CVE-2024-8190, going from patch diffing to double-checking that this is an authenticated vulnerability. He writes "We theorize that most likely users who have been exploited have never logged in to the appliance, or due to lack of rate limiting may have had poor password hygiene and had weaker passwords."

#CVE_2024_8190 #Ivanti #vulnerability #IvantiCSA #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #zeroday #CVE

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T14:10:08.000Z ##

CISA Adds Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance Vulnerability to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog (CVE-2024-8190)

CISA has added CVE-2024-8190, an OS command injection flaw in Ivanti CSA 4.6, to its KEV catalog and requires immediate patching or upgrade to CSA...

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/mqtp0l

A critical security flaw in Ivanti CSA (CVE-2024-8190) is being actively exploited, posing a significant risk of full system compromise. With Ivanti CSA 4.6 reaching end-of-life, urgent action is needed to address this vulnerability. Stay informed and take necessary precautions.

CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-10T18:30:54

10 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.330Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.288Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
cedric@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T06:02:10.000Z ##

@adulau actually it started very low:

$ curl -s 'https://api.first.org/data/v1/epss?cve=cve-2024-43491&scope=time-series' | jq '.data[0]."time-series"[-1]'
{
"epss": "0.00712000",
"percentile": "0.80862000",
"date": "2024-09-11"
}

adulau at 2024-09-26T04:35:46.578Z ##

Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

🔗 https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/cve-2024-43491

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.000Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##

CVE-2024-8387
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-06T18:32:29

1 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 129, Firefox ESR 128.1, and Thunderbird 128.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130 and Firefox ESR < 128.2.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:55:10.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of September 2, 2024
Sometimes I check the summary for hidden gems. This time, five of the Mozilla Firefox CVEs are CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical

  • CVE-2024-8381 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8384 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8385 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8387 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8389 memory corruption

At a glance, they're obviously high severity. It's just that you won't have that sense of urgency at the time of announcement because you didn't see the CVSS score, or understand the impact.

Let's not forget to mention Hall of Shame Progress Software for having LoadMaster vulnerability CVE-2024-7591 with a perfect 10.0 🥳

##

CVE-2024-8385
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-06T17:15:17.980000

1 posts

A difference in the handling of StructFields and ArrayTypes in WASM could be used to trigger an exploitable type confusion vulnerability. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130, Firefox ESR < 128.2, and Thunderbird < 128.2.

##

CVE-2024-8384
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-09-06T17:15:17.847000

1 posts

The JavaScript garbage collector could mis-color cross-compartment objects if OOM conditions were detected at the right point between two passes. This could have led to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130, Firefox ESR < 128.2, Firefox ESR < 115.15, Thunderbird < 128.2, and Thunderbird < 115.15.

1 repos

##

CVE-2024-43102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-05T15:34:39

1 posts

Concurrent removals of certain anonymous shared memory mappings by using the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request of UMTX_OP_SHM can lead to decreasing the reference count of the object representing the mapping too many times, causing it to be freed too early. A malicious code exercizing the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request in parallel can panic the kernel or enable further Use-After-Free attacks, potentiall

1 repos

CVE-2024-8362
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-04T15:31:39

1 posts

Use after free in WebAudio in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.119 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.000Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia

Nuclei template

tecteschi@mastodon.social at 2024-09-23T05:48:31.000Z ##

https://go.twuai.com/ping/7417711362102369846 Investigadores de seguridad de Akamai han identificado una vulnerabilidad crítica en las cámaras de seguridad AVTECH, conocida como CVE-2024-7029. Esta falla permite a atacantes remotos inyectar comandos y tomar control de los dispositivos afectados, facilitando la propagación de la botnet "Corona Mirai".

La vulnerabilidad se localiza en la función de "brillo" del firmware de las cámaras y fue descubierta por Aline...

One Identity Safeguard for Privileged Passwords before 7.5.2 allows unauthorized access because of an issue related to cookies. This only affects virtual appliance installations (VMware or HyperV). The fixed versions are 7.0.5.1 LTS, 7.4.2, and 7.5.2.

EPSS: 95.63%

updated 2024-08-30T00:31:29

6 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.0, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to retrieve the users encrypted password.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-17T11:47:53.517Z ##

Update :
CISA has added CVE-2024-6670 to its 'Known Exploited vulnerabilities catalog'. IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

Link: https://cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

CVE ID: CVE-2024-6670
Vendor: Progress
Product: WhatsUp Gold
Date Added: 2024-09-16
Vulnerability: Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability
Notes: https://community.progress.com/s/article/WhatsUp-Gold-Security-Bulletin-August-2024 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-6670
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-6670

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T14:49:10.331Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off of the press that CISA hasn't started making the CISA alert yet.

  • CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft during Patch Tuesday) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-6670 (9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proof of concept) Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability

#cisa #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_43461 #microsoft #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_6670 #proofofconcept #whatsupgold #progress

##

CVE-2024-29269
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

##

CVE-2024-28987
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 94.16%

updated 2024-08-22T00:31:11

4 posts

The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

CVE-2024-29857
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-15T19:35:09.613000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in ECCurve.java and ECCurve.cs in Bouncy Castle Java (BC Java) before 1.78, BC Java LTS before 2.73.6, BC-FJA before 1.0.2.5, and BC C# .Net before 2.3.1. Importing an EC certificate with crafted F2m parameters can lead to excessive CPU consumption during the evaluation of the curve parameters.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T14:57:24.060Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - September 17 2024
I keep forgetting that Atlassian does third Tuesday of the month for #PatchTuesday. Multiple products are updated:

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS (Denial of Service)
  • Bitbucket Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-32007 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-22871 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Crowd Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS

No mention of exploitation.

Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-09-15T10:53:52.000Z ##

Wow. My 6 year old Lenovo ThinkPad T480 got a new Firmware upgrade 1.52 today via fwupd. They actually published a new update after all that time 😯 Just a "fwupdmgr update" in Linux was enough to upgrade it.

Version 1.52 (UEFI BIOS)
[Important updates]
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-29979, CVE-2024-29980.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-24853.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2023-45236, CVE-2023-45237.

[New functions or enhancements]
- Updated the Diagnostics module to version 04.35.000.
- Updated the CPU microcode.

#thinkpad #t480 #fwupd #linux

##
Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-09-15T10:53:52.000Z ##

Wow. My 6 year old Lenovo ThinkPad T480 got a new Firmware upgrade 1.52 today via fwupd. They actually published a new update after all that time 😯 Just a "fwupdmgr update" in Linux was enough to upgrade it.

Version 1.52 (UEFI BIOS)
[Important updates]
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-29979, CVE-2024-29980.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-24853.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2023-45236, CVE-2023-45237.

[New functions or enhancements]
- Updated the Diagnostics module to version 04.35.000.
- Updated the CPU microcode.

RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to ac

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.393Z ##

Cloudflare: Unraveling SloppyLemming’s Operations Across South Asia
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! If Cloudflare had their own threat actor name, it’d be SloppyCTI.

See related Security Week reporting: India-Linked Hackers Targeting Pakistani Government, Law Enforcement

#threatintel #SloppyLemming #OutriderTiger #IOC #CTI #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec #CVE_2023_38831 #vulnerability #eitw #cyberespionage #India #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.000Z ##

Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! CVE-2024-28986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.98%

updated 2024-08-14T00:31:10

2 posts

SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine. While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing.   However, out of an abundance of caution, we re

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##

##
flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-25T18:23:21.000Z ##

## Ivanti vTM Flaw Under Active Attack: Patch Now! 🚨

This critical vulnerability allows attackers to bypass authentication and gain admin access. Affected versions include 22.2, 22.3, 22.3R2, 22.5R1, 22.6R1, and 22.7R1. #Cybersecurity #Vulnerability #Ivanti #vTM

https://securityonline.info/cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-ivanti-vtm-flaw-cve-2024-7593-cvss-9-8-poc-published/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-25T12:18:48.701Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-7593, this auth bypass flaw is caused by an incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm that lets remote unauthenticated attackers circumvent authentication on Internet-exposed vTM admin panels. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-ivanti-vtm-auth-bypass-bug-now-exploited-in-attacks/

##

screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T14:57:24.060Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - September 17 2024
I keep forgetting that Atlassian does third Tuesday of the month for #PatchTuesday. Multiple products are updated:

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS (Denial of Service)
  • Bitbucket Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-32007 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS
    • CVE-2024-22871 (7.5 High) DoS
  • Crowd Data Center and Server: CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 High) DoS

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-08-08T05:06:16

8 posts

### Summary Multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. ### Details The GeoTools library API that GeoServer calls evaluates property/attribute names for feature types in a way that unsafely passes them to the common

Nuclei template

https://github.com/peiqiF4ck/WebFrameworkTools-5.1-main

breachhq at 2024-09-26T14:15:06.292Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
In September 2024, the Chinese APT group known as Earth Baxia targeted a government organization in Taiwan and other entities within the Asia-Pacific region by exploiting a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in GeoServer (CVE-2024-36401). This flaw, caused by unsafe evaluation of property names as XPath expressions, has a CVSS score of 9.8 and affects GeoServer versions prior to 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2.

The thr...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/taiwan/2024-sep

##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

So here is the game. If you see a @geoserver instance, and you can read the version number on the welcome, please ask the admin to read the following post: https://geoserver.org/vulnerability/2024/09/12/cve-2024-36401.html

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

#geoserver #foss4g #osgeo

##
flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-21T17:01:19.000Z ##

## Earth Baxia Targets Taiwan with Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit

Cybersecurity researchers warn of a coordinated attack leveraging spear-phishing and a GeoServer vulnerability, targeting a Taiwanese government organization and potentially other entities in Asia-Pacific. #Cybersecurity #GeoServer #Taiwan #AsiaPacific

https://securityonline.info/sophisticated-cyber-espionage-earth-baxia-uses-cve-2024-36401-and-cobalt-strike-to-infiltrate-apac/

https://www.flagthis.com/?pid=3982

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T11:27:39.931Z ##

Trend Micro: Earth Baxia Uses Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit to Target APAC
Trend Micro with their silly threat actor naming schema: Earth Baxia is a China-based cyber espionage group. They targeted a government organization in Taiwan, and potentially others in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region using spear-phishing emails and by leveraging CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer, added to CISA KEV 15 July 2024, has proof of concept) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability. The threat actor employs GrimResource and AppDomainManager injection to deploy additional payloads. Customized Cobalt Strike components were deployed on compromised machines through the two initial access vectors. The altered version of Cobalt Strike included modified internal signatures and a changed configuration structure for evasion. Earth Baxia also used a new backdoor named EAGLEDOOR, which supports multiple communication protocols for information gathering and payload delivery. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_36401 #EarthBaxia #china #cyberespionage #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cobaltstrike #geoserver #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #taiwan #apac

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-15T00:41:41.106Z ##

@da_667 Other references for this OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical)
  • disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer
  • added to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog 15 July 2024 (within 2 weeks)
  • Proof of concept available (see parent toot I replied to)
  • GeoServer CVE-2024-36401 security advisory
##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T11:27:39.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Earth Baxia Uses Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit to Target APAC
Trend Micro with their silly threat actor naming schema: Earth Baxia is a China-based cyber espionage group. They targeted a government organization in Taiwan, and potentially others in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region using spear-phishing emails and by leveraging CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer, added to CISA KEV 15 July 2024, has proof of concept) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability. The threat actor employs GrimResource and AppDomainManager injection to deploy additional payloads. Customized Cobalt Strike components were deployed on compromised machines through the two initial access vectors. The altered version of Cobalt Strike included modified internal signatures and a changed configuration structure for evasion. Earth Baxia also used a new backdoor named EAGLEDOOR, which supports multiple communication protocols for information gathering and payload delivery. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_36401 #EarthBaxia #china #cyberespionage #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cobaltstrike #geoserver #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #taiwan #apac

CVE-2024-27348
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.34%

updated 2024-08-02T15:40:39

6 posts

RCE-Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server.This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.3.0 in Java8 & Java11 Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.3.0 with Java11 & enable the Auth system, which fixes the issue.

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-18T15:01:52.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-27348
Vendor: Apache
Product: HugeGraph-Server
Date Added: 2024-09-18
Vulnerability: Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://lists.apache.org/thread/nx6g6htyhpgtzsocybm242781o8w5kq9 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-27348
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-27348

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.925Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##

  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

updated 2024-08-02T11:16:14.367000

DrayTek Vigor2960 v1.5.1.4 allows an authenticated attacker with network access to the web management interface to inject operating system commands via the mainfunction.cgi 'parameter' parameter. NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

updated 2024-08-01T13:51:19.560000

2 posts

An improper input validation of the p2c parameter in the Apache CXF JOSE code before 4.0.5, 3.6.4 and 3.5.9 allows an attacker to perform a denial of service attack by specifying a large value for this parameter in a token.

CVE-2024-36991
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 9.79%

updated 2024-07-22T15:00:45.110000

1 posts

In Splunk Enterprise on Windows versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10, an attacker could perform a path traversal on the /modules/messaging/ endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows. This vulnerability should only affect Splunk Enterprise on Windows.

Nuclei template

psytester at 2024-09-14T13:08:03.630Z ##

Splunk Windows Path Traversal CVE-2024-36991 not only works on "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in vulnerable versions.
All module names located in /opt/splunk/share/splunk/search_mrsparkle/modules/ are usable.
--> Root entry points "/modules/nav/" and "/modules/paginator/" are working as well.
Fully unauthenticated access according to its CVSS score. 👍

##

CVE-2024-34750
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T16:22:37.120000

2 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When processing an HTTP/2 stream, Tomcat did not handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. This led to a miscounting of active HTTP/2 streams which in turn led to the use of an incorrect infinite timeout which allowed connections to remain open which should have been closed.

1 repos

#search_error

CVE-2024-37893
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-20T12:44:22.977000

1 posts

Firefly III is a free and open source personal finance manager. In affected versions an MFA bypass in the Firefly III OAuth flow may allow malicious users to bypass the MFA-check. This allows malicious users to use password spraying to gain access to Firefly III data using passwords stolen from other sources. As OAuth applications are easily enumerable using an incrementing id, an attacker could t

skelmis at 2024-09-19T14:26:27.877Z ##

##

CVE-2023-36745
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-29T03:15:59.870000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/N1k0la-T/CVE-2023-36745

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.278Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##

CVE-2020-1472
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 46.56%

updated 2024-05-23T17:56:29.137000

4 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.133Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #ransomhub #ransomware #WaterBakunawa #infosec #IOC #CVE_2020_1472 #ZeroLogon #vulnerability #mitreattack #EDRKillShifter #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #raas

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.000Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #ransomhub #ransomware #WaterBakunawa #infosec #IOC #CVE_2020_1472 #ZeroLogon #vulnerability #mitreattack #EDRKillShifter #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #raas

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.133Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #ransomhub #ransomware #WaterBakunawa #infosec #IOC #CVE_2020_1472 #ZeroLogon #vulnerability #mitreattack #EDRKillShifter #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #raas

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.000Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

A vulnerability has been found in Tongda OA and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file general/system/seal_manage/dianju/delete_log.php. The manipulation of the argument DELETE_STR leads to sql injection. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 11.10 is able to address this issue. ##

CVE-2024-3640(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-16T18:30:41

2 posts

An unquoted executable path exists in the Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk® Remote Access™ possibly resulting in remote code execution if exploited. While running the FTRA installer package, the executable path is not properly quoted, which could allow a threat actor to enter a malicious executable and run it as a System user. A threat actor needs admin privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

9 repos

##

CVE-2024-21338
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.43%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:45

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.426Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.000Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##

CVE-2024-20685
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:34

3 posts

Azure Private 5G Core Denial of Service Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T12:49:44.420Z ##

Trend Micro: Vulnerabilities in Cellular Packet Cores Part IV: Authentication
Trend Micro describes two vulnerabilities in Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core (AP5GC). This article is the latest in a series about vulnerabilities in cellular packet cores, using various commercial and open-source products as examples. They are focused more on systemic issues and attack vectors. CVE-2024-20685 (5.9 medium, assigned 09 April 2024) Azure Private 5G Core Denial of Service Vulnerability can lead to potential service outages. Another yet-unassigned vulnerability ZDI-CAN-23960 is titled Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core Un- Authenticated Base Station Override, would disconnect and replace attached base stations, disrupting network operations. Trend Micro gives an overview of cellular network architecture, describes the vulnerabilities and their impact.

#microsoft #ap5gc #cellularnetwork #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20685

##
antenna@well.com at 2024-09-18T10:31:04.000Z ##

"Our research reveals two significant vulnerabilities in Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core (AP5GC). The first vulnerability (CVE-2024-20685) allows a crafted signaling message to crash the control plane, leading to potential service outages. The second (ZDI-CAN-23960) disconnects and replaces attached base stations, disrupting network operations. While these issues are implementation-specific, their exploitation is made possible by a systemic weakness" - https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/i/vulnerabilities-in-cellular-packet-cores-part-iv-authentication.html

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-18T12:49:44.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Vulnerabilities in Cellular Packet Cores Part IV: Authentication
Trend Micro describes two vulnerabilities in Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core (AP5GC). This article is the latest in a series about vulnerabilities in cellular packet cores, using various commercial and open-source products as examples. They are focused more on systemic issues and attack vectors. Another yet-unassigned vulnerability ZDI-CAN-23960 is titled Microsoft Azure Private 5G Core Un- Authenticated Base Station Override, would disconnect and replace attached base stations, disrupting network operations. updated 2024-04-04T07:46:13

2 posts

fake_upload.cgi on the Telstra Smart Modem Gen 2 (Arcadyan LH1000), firmware versions < 0.18.15r, allows unauthenticated attackers to upload firmware images and configuration backups, which could allow them to alter the firmware or the configuration on the device, ultimately leading to code execution as root.

##

CVE-2023-36777
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-04-04T07:37:52

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.278Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

CVE-2023-28324
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.31%

updated 2024-04-04T05:19:27

2 posts

A improper input validation vulnerability exists in Ivanti Endpoint Manager 2022 and below that could allow privilege escalation or remote code execution.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T19:38:17.557Z ##

Following Summoning Team's accusation that Horizon3 published a vulnerability details and proof of concept for the wrong CVE, Horizon3 updated their blog post: CVE-2023-28324 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Improper Input Validation

We initially wrote this post in reference to CVE-2024-29847, however this post actually describes CVE-2023-28324. We had incorrectly assumed that the SU5 update was comprehensive which resulted in us mistaking CVE-2023-28324 for CVE-2024-29847. The content of this blog has been updated accordingly.

h/t: @buherator cc: @cR0w

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-16T19:38:17.000Z ##

Following Summoning Team's accusation that Horizon3 published a vulnerability details and proof of concept for the wrong CVE, Horizon3 updated their blog post: CVE-2023-28324 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Improper Input Validation

We initially wrote this post in reference to CVE-2024-29847, however this post actually describes CVE-2023-28324. We had incorrectly assumed that the SU5 update was comprehensive which resulted in us mistaking CVE-2023-28324 for CVE-2024-29847. The content of this blog has been updated accordingly.

h/t: @buherator cc: @cR0w

##

CVE-2023-32233
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T03:52:40

2 posts

In the Linux kernel through 6.3.1, a use-after-free in Netfilter nf_tables when processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read and write operations on kernel memory. Unprivileged local users can obtain root privileges. This occurs because anonymous sets are mishandled.

1 repos

#search_error

agresor at 2024-09-15T14:09:00.779Z ##

CVE-2023-32233 i powrót unprivileged user namespaces ( https://nfsec.pl/security/6502 ) #linux #security #containers #nftables #twittermigration

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSav7HayxtI

CVE-2023-29383
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T03:28:57

2 posts

In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make

agresor at 2024-09-24T20:10:50.744Z ##

CVE-2023-29383 – nadużywanie polecenia chfn do fałszowania danych z /etc/passwd ( https://nfsec.pl/security/6510 ) #linux #security #twittermigration

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9YNWvnX5z0Q

4 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the way the Task Scheduler Service validates certain file operations, aka 'Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.

Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-18
Vulnerability: Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2019-1069 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1069
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1069

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-18T14:09:44.925Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Five Known Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off the press that CISA's press team hasn't created the page yet. 5 are being added to the KEV:

  • CVE-2020-14644 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-21445 (9.8 critical) Oracle JDeveloper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2019-1069 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high) Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical) Apache HugeGraph-Server Improper Access Control Vulnerability

#Cisa #KEV #vulnerability #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

CVE-2023-45236
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-03-17T05:01:15

2 posts

EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a predictable TCP Initial Sequence Number. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access and potentially lead to a loss of Confidentiality.

Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-09-15T10:53:52.000Z ##

Wow. My 6 year old Lenovo ThinkPad T480 got a new Firmware upgrade 1.52 today via fwupd. They actually published a new update after all that time 😯 Just a "fwupdmgr update" in Linux was enough to upgrade it.

Version 1.52 (UEFI BIOS)
[Important updates]
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-29979, CVE-2024-29980.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-24853.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2023-45236, CVE-2023-45237.

[New functions or enhancements]
- Updated the Diagnostics module to version 04.35.000.
- Updated the CPU microcode.

#thinkpad #t480 #fwupd #linux

##

CVE-2023-38646
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 88.91%

updated 2024-02-15T16:15:45.380000

2 posts

Metabase open source before 0.46.6.1 and Metabase Enterprise before 1.46.6.1 allow attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the server, at the server's privilege level. Authentication is not required for exploitation. The other fixed versions are 0.45.4.1, 1.45.4.1, 0.44.7.1, 1.44.7.1, 0.43.7.2, and 1.43.7.2.

CVE-2023-25690
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.04%

updated 2024-01-02T16:15:11.563000

2 posts

Some mod_proxy configurations on Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 through 2.4.55 allow a HTTP Request Smuggling attack. Configurations are affected when mod_proxy is enabled along with some form of RewriteRule or ProxyPassMatch in which a non-specific pattern matches some portion of the user-supplied request-target (URL) data and is then re-inserted into the proxied request-target using va

1 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-09-22T18:27:46.904Z ##

@ntkramer Can you haphazard a guess as to why there's a sudden uptick of exploitation attempts? I don't know if if CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed is automatable.

CVE-2023-4966 is known to be used in ransomware campaigns: Lockbit reported 21 November 2023: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa23-325a

Additional resources:

  • security advisory: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX579459-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20234966-and-cve20234967?language=en_US
  • Netscaler recommendations: https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-for-cve-2023-4966/
  • Mandiant investigation includes Yara rule: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/session-hijacking-citrix-cve-2023-4966/
  • Unit 42 threat brief: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-cve-2023-4966-netscaler-citrix-bleed/
  • DHS malware analysis report from CitrixBleed security incidents: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-reports/ar23-325a
##

CVE-2023-3852
(4.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.63%

updated 2023-11-10T05:03:51

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in OpenRapid RapidCMS up to 1.3.1. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /admin/upload.php. The manipulation of the argument file leads to unrestricted upload. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The name of the patch is 4dff387283060961c362d50105ff8da8ea40bcbe.

2 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities exist in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers.
